Package com.meepcraft.backbone.api.player

Interface GlobalPlayer

  • public interface GlobalPlayer
    Denotes a player somewhere in the universe.
    Author:
    Caleb L. Power

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  GlobalPlayer.Status
      The current status of this player.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean createInventory​(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Creates and returns a new inventory corresponding with a particular UUID if the inventory has not been created already.
      boolean dropInventory​(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Drops an inventory corresponding with a particular UUID.
      boolean equals​(GlobalPlayer player)
      Determines if this global player is the same as another global player.
      java.util.Date getFirstSeenTimestamp()
      Retrieves the date and time at which the player was first seen.
      java.lang.String getIGN()
      Retrieves the player's in-game name.
      GlobalLocation getLastKnownLocation()
      Retrieves the last known global location of the player.
      java.util.Date getLastSeenTimestamp()
      Retrieves the date and time at which the player was seen last.
      GlobalLocation getLocation()
      Retrieves the location of this player.
      GlobalPlayer.Status getStatus()
      Retrieves the current status of the player.
      java.util.UUID getUUID()
      Retrieves the player's unique identifier.
      boolean isOnline()
      Determines if the player in question is online.
      boolean playNote​(org.bukkit.Instrument instrument, org.bukkit.Note note)
      Plays a note to the player and surrounding players.
      boolean playSound​(org.bukkit.Sound sound, float volume, float pitch)
      Plays a sound to the player and surrounding players.
      GlobalPlayerInventory retrieveInventory​(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Retrieves the inventory corresponding to the unique identifier in question.
      java.util.Set<java.util.UUID> retrieveInventoryIDs()
      Retrieves a set of unique inventory identifiers.
      boolean sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Sends a message to a particular player.
      boolean sendTitle​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String subtitle, int fadeInDuration, int staticDuration, int fadeOutDuration)
      Sends a message title to a particular player.
      boolean teleportPlayer​(GlobalLocation location)
      Teleports a player to some location in the universe.

        Retrieves the date and time at which the player was first seen.
        Returns:
        the timestamp correlating to when the player was first seen

      • getLastSeenTimestamp

        java.util.Date getLastSeenTimestamp()
        Retrieves the date and time at which the player was seen last.
        Returns:
        the timestamp correlating to when the player was seen last

      • equals

        boolean equals​(GlobalPlayer player)
        Determines if this global player is the same as another global player.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to compare
        Returns:
        true if the players are the same

      • isOnline

        boolean isOnline()
        Determines if the player in question is online.
        Returns:
        true if the player is online

      • getLocation

        GlobalLocation getLocation()
        Retrieves the location of this player.
        Returns:
        a GlobalLocation denoting the location of this player

        boolean sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a message to a particular player.
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        Returns:
        true on transmission preflight check success

      • sendTitle

        boolean sendTitle​(java.lang.String title,
                  java.lang.String subtitle,
                  int fadeInDuration,
                  int staticDuration,
                  int fadeOutDuration)
        Sends a message title to a particular player.
        Parameters:
        title - the message title
        subtitle - the message subtitle
        fadeInDuration - the tick duration of the fade-in effect
        staticDuration - the length in ticks that the effect stays in place
        fadeOutDuration - the tick duration of the fade-out effect
        Returns:
        true on transmission preflight check success

        Plays a note to the player and surrounding players.
        Parameters:

        note - the note in question
        Returns:
        true on transmission preflight check success

                  float pitch)
        Plays a sound to the player and surrounding players.
        Parameters:

        volume - the volume of the sound
        pitch - the pitch of the sound
        Returns:
        true on transmission preflight check success

        Teleports a player to some location in the universe.
        Parameters:
        location - the location
        Returns:

      • retrieveInventoryIDs

        java.util.Set<java.util.UUID> retrieveInventoryIDs()
        Retrieves a set of unique inventory identifiers.
        Returns:
        a set of UUIDs

      • retrieveInventory

        GlobalPlayerInventory retrieveInventory​(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Retrieves the inventory corresponding to the unique identifier in question.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the unique identifier of the inventory in question
        Returns:
        a GlobalPlayerInventory object representing the queried inventory, or null if there is no corresponding inventory

      • createInventory

        boolean createInventory​(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Creates and returns a new inventory corresponding with a particular UUID if the inventory has not been created already.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the new inventory's proposed unique identifier
        Returns:
        true if a new inventory was created successfully, or false if that particular UUID already exists

      • dropInventory

        boolean dropInventory​(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Drops an inventory corresponding with a particular UUID.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the unique identifier of the inventory in question
        Returns:
        true if the inventory was dropped, or false if the inventory didn't exist
